author: Special Correspondent
text:
Periyar University here has received a grant of Rs 10 crore for its developmental activities under the RUSA (Rashtriya Uchchatar Shiksha Abhiyan) scheme.

The grant will be utilised for infrastructure development, to undertake renovation activities and procure equipment for the university, a press release from C. Swaminathan, Vice-Chancellor, issued here on Thursday said.

The funds are released as part of the Ministry of Human Resource Development scheme RUSA.

There was a master plan under various schemes to all States to develop higher education in the country.

Subsequently, the schemes will be funded partly by the State government and the Centre in the ratio of 1:4 respectively.

Plans

The plans were drafted and the baseline data were collected through the coordinating agency for each State ie. the State Council for Higher Education in Tamil Nadu, he said.

The plans and schemes were drafted by each university through a RUSA coordinator, he added.

The proposals were invited and vetted before presenting it to the ministry.
title: Periyar University gets Rs. 10 crore as grant
